column4: hi guys question. box A cant get through firewall to internet, but can get to box B which can get out to the internet. I need to be able to update and install things on box A. How would I go about an SSH tunnel allowing this?
use ssh's socks proxy
-D
please elaborate
openssh has a socks proxy facility built in. Use -d <port>, put that  into /etc/apt/apt.conf and there you go
there is no /etc/apt/apt.conf file
I already told you, nearly an hour ago
you didn't tell me you told me "ssh -D" and wouldnt explain further. sorry for cleaqrly being a fucking noob but thats not a full explanation in my book

I told you to use -D <port>, which creates a socks proxy, which you can put into apt.conf. Which part don't you get? Try to read ssh's manpage, read apt.conf's manpage, expedially the proxy part, try that and ask specifically if you run into problems
there is no /etc/apt/apt.conf
then create one. There is none by default, if you create one apt will honor it
ssh -fCND localhost:1080 user@remoteboxthathasaccesstointernet
Did you try using an IP address? Maybe your dns server does not resolve everything
and: what kind of proxy did you setup in firefox?
tried IP, no go. Manual proxy config -> HTTP proxy and us this roxy for all protocols checked
it's no http proxy. It's a socks proxy, I wrote that multiple times already
did you configure both proxy types?
ah ha - i had to clear all other options other than socks5
well, of course, else you end up trying to use the wrong proxy type, which won't work
how would I set apt.cfg to point to proxy then?
just read about that, you need to use tsocks: tsocks apt-get update for example. apt doesn't know how to handle socks on it's own
ob course not. Just download it manually and scp it there
apt-get --print-uris install socks5
